summary:
I am a highly motivated junior software engineer, I enjoy working in fast-paced nurturing environments in which I can develop my software engineering skills to create clean and maintainable solutions.
I am extremely passionate about learning and work hard to expand my knowledge, sharpen my skills and stay up to date.

I have a wide range of skills and knowledge including but not limited to: C#, Angular, Docker, Kubernetes, Monolithic and Microservices architectures, Relational and non Relational databases.

Here is my GitHub account: https://github.com/rawan-a-d

projects.title: HandiWork
projects.description:
A personal project I worked on in the third year of my study.

HandiWork is a web-app where people who are skilled at some sort of manual work can offer their services.

This semester was about building Enterprise software which of course means highly scalable and available software. Security and maintainability should also be taken into consideration.

I built the system using the following technologies and techniques:
•	Microservices architecture using ASP.NET: increased scalability and better resiliency.
•	Asynchronous communication using RabbitMQ.
•	Angular TypeScript framework for the frontend.
•	Docker and Kubernetes deployment.
•	Microsoft Azure deployment (databases and software).
•	GitHub CI/CD pipelines (Docker build and push, Datree Kubernetes files validation, K6 load testing, Nuget package deployment, Snyk security checks, ArgoCD pull-based GitOps).
•	Performance/Load testing using K6.
•	Implementing Security by design concepts and taking OWASP Top 10 into consideration.
•	Distributed databases on Microsoft Azure and Cloudinary.

projects.title: SeeThrough
projects.description:
In the third year of my study, I worked on this project with 5 other students.

SeeThrough is Q&A Platform with Tinder flavours, Users can ask questions in selected communities and can answer them through a personalized question feed.
SeeThrough's main stakeholders are part of a research group at Fontys that focusses on visually impaired people so Accessibility has been part of the project from day-one.

The stakeholders goals are defined as follows:
•	Can technology help visually impaired people with asking difficult and intimate questions?
•	How do people respond and use this developed app?
•	Furthermore SeeThrough has been built with scalability in mind meaning an Event driven microservices architecture was the chosen approach. This architecture has been deployed in a Kubernetes cluster.

projects.title: Cookery
projects.description:
A personal project I worked on in the second year of my study.

Cookery is a web-app where people who are interested in cooking can come together and share their personal recipes and follow interesting users.  It can be used by two types of users: admins and clients.

The web app consists of a RESTful API built using Java framework (Jersey) and a front-end built with Angular.
I also implemented unit testing using a mocking framework called Mockito, a unit testing framework called JUnit and H2 in-memory database.

Client: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/Cookery-Client
Server: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/Cookery

projects.title: FontysIN
projects.description:
In the second year of my study, I worked on this project with a team of four students.

The project was requested by Fontys. It is a Linked-in like website for Fontys users only which establishes a connection channel and allows users to better find other users with similar interest, get help when they need it and build a strong portfolio.

We built a web app which consists of a RESTful API using Java framework (Jersey) and Angular framework for the front-end.
We also implemented unit testing using a mocking framework called Mockito,   a unit testing framework called JUnit and H2 in memory database.

Personally, I worked on the messaging and the connections features in both the backend as well as the frontend.
I also set up unit testing, the in memory database and implemented unit tests for the features I worked on.

Client: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/FontysIN-Semester-3-Client
Server: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/FontysIN-Semester-3

projects.title: DevQuiz with Laravel
projects.description:
In the first year of my study, I worked on this project with another student.

DevQuiz is a website where programmers can do programming quizzes to test their knowledge.
Our website was built with Laravel and can be used by two types of users (admins and subscribers).
The admin can manage users, quizzes and messages and the subscriber can do quizzes and contact admins.

projects.title: Media Bazaar
projects.description:
In the first year of my study, I worked with three other students on this project.

Media Bazaar, a hardware company opened their first shop in Eindhoven and they are having issues managing employees, stock and work shifts. Therefore they requested our services.

We built a desktop application for the management using C# that can be used by three types of users (administrators, managers and depot workers) to manage employees and stock and see different statistics.
Additionally, a website for employees was built using PHP where they can see their work schedule and perform many actions easily such as declaring availabilities, confirming attendance, rejecting or accepting an assigned shift and calling in sick.

Personally, I worked on the account management and the statistics in the C# application.
As for the PHP website I was responsible for creating the entire employees’ schedule.

Website: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/Media-Bazaar-Staff
Application: https://github.com/rawan-a-d/Media-Bazaar-Management

projects.title: DevQuiz
projects.description:
In the first year of my study, I worked on this project with another student.

DevQuiz is a website where programmers can do programming quizzes to test and improve their knowledge.
Our website was built with PHP and can be used by two types of users (admins and subscribers).
The admin can manage users, quizzes and messages and the subscriber can do quizzes and contact admins.

projects.title: Student Housing
projects.description:
I worked on this project with two other students in the first year of my study.

Student Housing BV owns a building where students can stay during their study in the Netherlands. Their buildings are composed of rooms, where each student gets their own room, and shared facilities such as toilets, a bathroom, a kitchen, etc. 
They are having problems managing tenants and getting students to follow the rules and perform their assigned tasks on time.

We developed a Windows application with C# for two types of users (tenants and admins from Student Housing).
It provided a channel for the users to properly communicate.
On top of that the admins can publish house rules, manage the tenants and their schedule.
The tenants can use it to divide their tasks and plan them, set up agreements between them, see house rules, create events which happen based on a voting system and see and adjust their personal info.
